s.text: Referring in an editorial Thursday to the "firestorm of anger and revulsion" that had followed the recent bombing in Omagh, Northern Ireland, the paper said that this "new crackdown, so late in the day, smacks of over-reaction."
Instead, it advocated a closer look at a prospective International Monetary Fund package, even though "[o]f course, an IMF programme would bring massive hardships for the common people."
